intro: Lophiaris pohliana, commonly known as the Pohliana lophiaris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It is typically found in coastal and mountainous areas, often growing in open, sunny habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
